title: Regime populations - OWID based on Lührmann et al. (2018), V-Dem (11.1), OWID (2021), Gapminder (v6), HYDE (v3.2), and UN (2019)
description:
This dataset provides information on the size of populations living under different political systems.

Population data comes from our own calculations based on Gapminder (v6), HYDE (v3.2), and UN (2019).

Political regimes are identified using the Regimes of the World classification from Lührmann et al. (2018), data from the Varieties of Democracy Project (v11.1), and expanding the data and refining the classification ourselves.

The classification distinguishes between closed autocracies, electoral autocracies, electoral democracies, and liberal democracies.

fields.name: People living in closed autocracies
fields.description:
This variable provides information on the number of people living in closed autocracies.

In closed autocracies, citizens do not have the right to either choose the chief executive of the government or the legislature through multi-party elections.

fields.name: People living in electoral autocracies
fields.description:
This variable provides information on the number of people living in electoral autocracies.

In electoral autocracies, citizens have the right to choose the chief executive and the legislature through multi-party elections; but they lack some freedoms, such as the freedoms of association or expression, that make the elections meaningful, free, and fair.

fields.name: People living in electoral democracies
fields.description:
This variable provides information on the number of people living in electoral democracies.

In electoral democracies, citizens have the right to participate in meaningful, free and fair, and multi-party elections.

fields.name: People living in liberal democracies
fields.description:
This variable provides information on the number of people living in liberal democracies.

In liberal democracies, citizens have further individual and minority rights, are equal before the law, and the actions of the executive are constrained by the legislative and the courts.

fields.name: People living in countries with missing regime data
fields.description: This variable provides information on the number of people living in countries without regime data.
